content: make it blue cowl #makeitbluecowl the make it blue cowl is beginner friendly and provides an extra touch of warmth to any cool-weather outfit it is worked top down in 2x2 ribbing with a simple slip selvedge for the front and back panels its small size also makes this an excellent scrap yarn project happy knitting watch the full video tutorial for this pattern on youtube https //youtu be/tadywxm3afi 1 yarn bulky weight yarn sandnes garn børstet alpakka in the color electric blue 6046 shown in pictures yardage approximately 150 meters/165 yards or 65 grams needles circular needles 5 mm us8 40 cm 16 inches or needles to meet gauge gauge 18 sts in 2x2 ribbing=10 cm with 5mm knitting needles or needles to meet gauge note row gauge is not needed in this pattern dimensions 35 cm/13 75in long by 25 cm/9 75 in wide pattern neck using the long tail cast on method co 88 sts onto your 5 mm us8 40 cm 16 inches circular needles join the work in the round and place a marker at the beginning of the round round 1 *k2 p2* to the end of the round repeat round 1 until your work reaches 17 cm/6 75 in or until the work reaches your preferred length before spitting for the front and back panels in the last round of the neck section stop one stitch before the beginning-of-round marker leaving the last purl stitch unworked you should still have 88 sts on your needles 2 front and back panels we are now going to separate our stitches into two identical panels and work flat in row place a second stitch marker where you finished the last round of the neck section -
